author: {'steamid': '76561198152323873', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1046, 'last_played': 1493056290}
review:
It's like Robocraft, except without loot crates and with a smaller, nicer community.

This game has litterally limitless potential, although you do need to climb a steep learning curve to be able to do some of the more insane things, ex. a fully-functioning VTOL aircraft. But once you learn enough you can build anything you can imagine.

I'm not doing this game justice with what I'm saying, just install it and check some (subtitled) tutorials, then build some cool stuff.

Also the developer isn't making it Free to Play but Pay to Win, like Freejam does with Robocraft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132220296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 30627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24975, 'last_played': 1704019497}
review:
[h1]2016/9/10現在、プレミアム用パーツのスタンプ各種は正常に機能しません。フルに活用できるプレミアムの機能はサーバー接続の優先度のみとなります[/h1]

頭の中のイメージをブロックで形作り、ジョイントで命を与える
マシンクラフトは自分の作ったモノを好きなように動かせることに加えて、[strike]ステージさえも作れるという画期的なクラフトゲームでした[/strike]
[u]＊2016/09/10 ステージは今後、外部ツールでのみ製作可能になる予定だそうです。[/u]

作品紹介や他のレビューでもあるように、各種機能を使いこなせばどんなイメージでも具現化できると思います



ただし、レビュー現在　それらを作るためのガイドや作ったモノで遊ぶためのコンテンツはあまり整っていません
特に対人競技に興味がない場合は遊べることがほとんどありません

[spoiler]  オンラインモードでは戦闘やレース等の目的をもってサーバーを立てたり参加したりできますが
戦闘やレースでは各々のマシンの性能差もあり、本格的にやる場合はレギュレーションを設定したりベースマシンを配布して競うことが主流となっています
目的のないサーバーにも多くのユニークなマシンが集まりますが、そこでは本当にマシンを見せ合うくらいしかありません
ボールを使った野球やサッカーなど、幅広いマシンで参加できる遊びは可能ですがそれらは[u] 誰かが企画してそれに人が参加して初めて成り立ちます [/u]
現状、遊び方はすべてプレイヤーに委ねられており　それはsteam進出前からずっと変わっていません　[/spoiler]

パネキットのようにお題があり、それを達成するためのマシンを作る
マインクラフトのようにクラフト以外に敵やボスがいて、倒しにいく
そういった分かりやすい目標がなく、物作りに飽きた時点で急速にやる気がなくなると思います


他の方からも声がありましたが、現状でも[u]物理演算のついた簡易的なモデリングツール[/u]としては優秀だと思います
[u]ゲームとしての面白さ[/u]を求めるのであれば、完成を待ちましょう

author: {'steamid': '76561198068216129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 10911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9139, 'last_played': 1494459993}
review: This game is just plain amazing. After the Robocraft Spectrum Update came out, I decided that I did not like the game anymore, so I stopped playing it. Pretty soon I started looking for other sandbox games to play. The ones that I purchased were fun and I loved playing them. Soon some of my freinds recommeded MachineCraft, and even though I sucked at it, I asked them for advice and recieved the help I needed, well for the most part. This is now one of my most played games and I think it is a cool idea to center it on construction, not combat. The creativity that you can put into your machines is unmatched by other games, and I definitly recommend it to anyone looking for a sandbox game built on creativity, advanced building mechanics, and how you can have lots of independence with the ability to create your own custom server and other fun things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095073674', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1692591331}
review:
a very good game once you get the hang of it, but untill then the rediculus learning curve is very daunting for players just getting into vehical building games. 
right now im working on a Helicarrier from avengers and ive put maybe 5 hours into it and im about half way done.

the multiplayer is a differnt story, i find it hard to get on a server because there a little to none sometimes, but when there is one open, youll see some crazy creations. unfortunelty  there are a bunch of players who grab a bot from the workshop, repaint it and claim it as thier own.

as a finall note some positives are
[list]
*large bots
*highly complex system of joints
*artistry and detail 
*real world mimicry (not the best)
*originality 
*color availibiltiy 
[/list]

the negitives
[list]
*massive learning cruve to get just an idea of the parts and there functions (theres a lot of them)
*mirror function insability (will flip settings in joints sometimes and sometimes it wont)
*long build times
*even longer functionality setup
*servers? (sometimes there are none availble)
*newbies (there are alot)
[/list]

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198143940268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 45574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3501, 'last_played': 1672799948}
review:
Отличная игра про строительство различных машин.В игре есть хорошая физика и много элементов,благодаря которым свои творения можно делать наиболее детализованными и реалистичными.Можно сделать танк,самолет,дирижабль,все что угодно,очень популярны мехи - а так же можно делать даже биокрафты - люди,животные,драконы и тд.
Многие считают что эта игра скопирована с робокрафта.Но на самом деле сама суть и задача в этих двух играх разная:в robocraft надо развиватся,сражаться в боях с игроками,строить убогие нагибучие кирпичи - и это поощряется разработчиками - а в machinecraft нет ограничений по валюте,очкам.Можно сделать совершенно что угодно,что можно сотворить фантазия,настроить это и посмотреть,что сделали другие игроки
Минусы в небольшом преимуществе премиум аккаунта и плохо разработанных режимах.
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198057235249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2490, 'last_played': 1615811161}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015089048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1894, 'last_played': 1462627514}
review:
Just get it. 
Still early access, and you can feel it, but already better than a lot of it's competition.

Pros:
-Great simplicity without hindering creativeness. Only 26 block types, and you can do more with it than with hundreds in Robocraft or From the Depths.
-Superior custom control options, in and easy accessible way.
-Physics handle all those spinners, hinges and pistons really well. 

Cons:
-No per-block damage makes combat pretty borring. You can only destroy sections or whole crafts by draining their HP.
-No internal parts (engines, generators, fuel tanks, batteries, ect).
-No stock AI for your crafts. Can be writen in Lua.
-Can't handle as big crafts as FtD
-Lacks some useful features in designer (keyboard-based building, block shrinking)
-Poor name.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115740916', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2345, 'last_played': 1555694359}
review:
[h] [b] Machinecraft [/b] [/h]

Well made game about building stuffs, different stuffs.
As an [b] early access game [/b], i barely found bugs and glitches to it.
There's [b] Multiplayer [/b] too !!
The workshop community built lots of awesome stuffs in this game, especially the [b] [i] Mechs and Tanks [/i] [/b]
There's a [b] Map editor [/b] too, so you can build places where your tank, mechs, cars, ships, spaceships, submarine or anything to move around and [b] battle [/b] too.*wink*

A bit of tweaking with the mirroring system and this game is going to be [b] [i] FAR MORE BETTER [/i] [/b] than Robocraft. I mean it's already better right now you know.

Thinking of playing Robocraft eh? Scratch it, this game is [b] not P2W [/b].
The performance or the visuals of the things you build will depend on your witts.

If you don't have a brain tho, go play robocraft and spend all your money trying to win in that stupid game.

[b] They will surely add more stuffs that will catch your interest if you do not feel like playing it right now. [/b]

Not much to say about this game now though, cause everything here depends on you.

Play this game now and build amazing things !!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982504799', 'num_games_owned': 4252, 'num_reviews': 2873, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1462146436}
review:
MachineCraft - игра с названием намекающим что она есть помесь из MineCraft`а и RoboCraft`а. Но на самом деле не все так однозначно. В этой игре также как и в вышеперечисленных основу геймплея составляет сборка предметов из блоков, но сборка здесь чуть сложнее и она составляет большую часть игры. Сложнее она потому что нам мало приделать к нашему пепелацу колеса, чтобы он поехал, надо еще настроить функции отдельных деталей, к примеру если мы ставим ротатор, сам по себе он вращаться не будет, надо будет отдельно указать в какую сторону он должен вращаться и с какой скоростью. Вот из-за этих небольших настроек в простенькой казалось бы игре скрывается большая глубина, ибо согласовать с собой различные детали, чтобы получившийся механизм двигался как нужно, не так то просто, и требует достаточной упорности. 

Покупать\добывать блоки в этой игре не нужно, все блоки имеются с самого начала. 90% игры это сбор нужного механизма, далее можно протестить его в разных режимах. Мультиплеер в игре имхо не очень большой, большая часть игроков тусуется в японском регионе (можно выбрать при создание\заходе на карту). Интерфейс в игре имхо не самый, удобный и красивый, графика впрочем тоже. Что плюс в стартовой менюшке есть ссылки на уроки по крафту в этой игре. Что также плюс, судя по новостной ленте игры, обновления выпускаются более-менее регулярно.

Как итог: честно говоря я колебался ставить палец вниз или же вверх. Дело в том что игра неплохой симулятор сборки механизмов, но на данный момент, он имхо сыроват, неказист графически, и из-за более сложного управления чем в том же RoboCraft`е предназначен больше для хардкорных фанов робокрафта подобных игр. Им он без сомнения понравится, но вот игрокам не столь харкдорным я эту игру рекомендовать не стал бы (по крайней мере на момент написания моего отзыва, когда игра еще в раннем доступе).
6 скрафтенных машин из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064115201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 53062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40983, 'last_played': 1666182830}
review:
Если сравнивать машинкрафт и робокрафт, то разница очень большая. Робокрафт - это всеравно что купить готовый конструктор и быстро отправить его в бой. Все детали уже знают что делать, настраивать ничего особо не нужно. 

Машинкрафт - это другой разговор. Его можно сравнить с долгим и упорным вырезанием из листа металла, паяния проводов и кропотливой настройки каждого элемента. Тут нету сборок на полминуты. Чтобы собрать что-то интересное, понадобится несколько часов, при этом никто не гарантирует вам, что вы соберете это и скажете "Это идеальная версия, ничего больше менять не буду". Конечно да, больше всего поражает именно страна-изготовитель этой игры. Что-что, а они умеют делать достоверные реплики моделей танков и самолетов. 

Что насчет минусов.

Во первых - опять-таки то самое сидение с паяльником. Оно отталкивает тех, кто не хочет в нем разбираться, потому что это им может быть не нужно.
Сервера. Их практически нет. Все основные сервера находятся в японском секторе, а individual вообще перестал работать.
Глюки с существующими серверами. Они попросту могут вас не пустить, хотя места есть. 
Обновления. Последнее обновление было год назад. Да, оно подарило несколько плюшек, но на этом все. 

Невысокий выбор оружия. Хотя виды оружия могут очень сильно отличаться по формам и размерам, их все-же мало. 3 вида снарядов пушек, 2 вида ракет, лазер, плазменные шары и контрмеры. Ну и еще мечи. Отличие только в том, у кого сильнее жахнет и кто больше смог вместить в свое детище.

В целом складывается ощущение, что игра медленно но верно умирает. Онлайн есть, но 20-30 человек - это много?

author: {'steamid': '76561198021122126', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1569715876}
review:
[h1]CONS[/h1]
- Confusing interface-- the menu is so complicated, don't even tell me about the ingame HUD! In the menu, there are links that open up an external browser (not Steam's INGAME browser) showing Youtube videos of how the game works... instead of just, you know, adding a digital manual within the game itself. I'm surprised nobody got seizures from this!
- Not optimized well. For a game that has old, PlayStation-like graphics, it shouldn't lag with 50-piece machines. But considering the fact that most modern Unity games I play, they would be badly optimized no matter what; so I'll blame the engine, not the game.
- Only comes in two languages-- English and Japanese. Sorry, Europeans. Looks like you'll have to learn either two to understand shit.
- Sounds are a minimal, so it'll be like watching a 1920s silent film.
- Multiplayer system is small, but that'll only be for a little while since this game JUST got released.
[h1]PROS[/h1]
- The graphics are pretty cute, I have to say. I really like how the whole game looks like it came straight from a 5th-generation console. It kinda reminds me of LSD Dream Emulator!
- A great concept, honestly, but it just wasn't executed well.
- It's free, so... you're not losing money!

[h][VERDICT[/h1]
6/10. If it wasn't for the poor sound system, complicated interface, and the excessive use of hyperlinks, I would've gave this game a better score good enough to recommend to anybody. I'm still gonna play this game, though. Just not as much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148870135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1527352394}
review:
[h1]Очень классная и крутая игра[/h1]
Пожалуй, опишу в конце а сейчас плюсы и минусы.
[h1]++++++++++++++++++++++++++++[/h1]
[list]
[*]ПОЛНЫЙ сандбокс [Sandbox]
[*]Давольно сложная и хорошо слаженная система управления машинами
[*]Получаются красивые машины (Или полное говно, которое вам нравится)
[*]Все детали настраиваешь сам
[*]Есть примеры деталей, если ты не знаешь как они работают
[*]Очень весело летать на неработающей машине (А точнее на пукане, когда он бомбонул, но это уже другая история...)
[/list]
[h1]---------------------------------------------------------[/h1]
Минусов давольно мало, но они есть
[list]
[*]К чёрту физику! Да кому она в жопу нужна!?
[*]Пукан бомбит от настройки деталей машины!
[/list]
[h1]Открытый мир[/h1]
Дальше постройки машины я не дошёл, повезло что пукан не бомбонул... (У кое-кого как водородная бомба взорвался :D)
[h1]Вывод[/h1]
Плюсов больше чем минусов, и "Ревизорро" рекомендует эту игру.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061736988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 12923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10491, 'last_played': 1516385181}
review:
I am writing a new review on here. The last one did not do it justice. Ignore the neg reviews by the kiddies with 0.1 hours played. Those are the kinds of people we dont want playing this game in the first place. Keep the robocrap community in robocrap. If you want to see what can be made in this game, simply check my screen shots or click on this games workshop.

This game is everything I thought it would be and than some. Whoever made this game is a genius. Japan server has 30 player matches so click on JP and click on it again and it will bring up games. Also try other servers and individuals. You can modify entire worlds in this game, while you are playing with friends. You can battle, race, use multiple weapon types at once, use ROTATING PLATFORMS, JOINTS, TURRETS and many other things other games fail to pull off. Seriously, this is going to be big. It is the minecraft of Bot building. You can fight on land, on sea and in the air. Your imagination is your only limitation. This game is not noob friendly though so if you have ADD or the mental capicity of an ant, you will waste your time downloading it. If you want to make something that flaps custom built wings you made, you can do that too and flapping those wings will actually provide lift.

I rate this 9.5 out of 10. Check my screenshots from this game. These are all things I and other people created in here, including transformers, cities, and even Godzilla and massive starships. This game is 100% free and no there is no catch. The person that made this game was just that nice. You can donate money if you want or buy DLC but that in no way gives you any combat advantages or anything. Just cosmetic stuff and private server options.

This game is seriously well worth the time and effort of learning it. Can you handle it? Make sure to enable EXPERT build mode so you have more options.

If you are confused about something, dont give up. Visit the games steam forum, people are really helpful if you are polite and genuinely want to learn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035134890', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1573064905}
review:
for the time i've played it, i was confused at first, but after a while i just went, "screw it, if i can't figure out how to build stuff yet, i'll just check out other people's creations"

and so i did...and they were pretty cool, this game already has so many possibilities, it's just that i suck at figuring things out even with tutorials XD!!!

well heres what i think in a pro's-con's type of thing:

Pro's:

you can pretty much build what ever you want whether it be planes, cars, walkers, space ships, giant flying death machines...(that's the big one)

it most likely, will be easy to understand for most people with tutorials and take their time to figure things out(im just an impatient uncreative guy when it comes to THIS stuff, XD sorry thats my fault)

in the long run, their might be much more added for fun of course.

con's:

it's an early access alpha, of course there will be a crap ton of mabye bugs or things that shouldnt happen or things not being fully ready yet, that can be the only con as this is...what? still pretty early in its development right? yeah, over all, the thought of this being finished with so many things in it would be epic...

so even the con points to it being better and there being more pro's in my opinion...

my personal cons:

my computer sucks so its laggy...

also, i don't know if its a bug, but its most likely my computer:

theres this thing where any time i'm in the building vehicle thing, every block for the vehicle that i place is pitch black...when i play, its the way it should...bug? or just my crappy pc?

im 90% sure its a problem at my end...sooo...its fine...and fun..

i'd recommend this to anyone with or even without creativity, and just like playing with these kind of games...why people without creativity to you may ask???

well, they can try out other peoples creations from the workshop...so yeah...



this game, while early access and alpha...has so many possibilities in the future...

though, for now, i'm going to put playing this game on hold till i get a better computer, still, when i tried it, it was very fun...

and as ussual:

 - Have a good day / night Everyone :D! ! !

review:
I don't know, I am on the fence with this.
It's a great little engine, and has tons of potential; but as others have said it's not user friendly at all.
The confusing UI, and complicated structure of the game means you will spend hours just watching/reading tutorials.

The reason things like Mario Maker, Minecraft, etc are so popular is because ease of access. They allow for tons of creativity but allow you to just dive in and start having fun.
This might have too steep of a learning curve to really catch on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258336699', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 384456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127422, 'last_played': 1709762008}
review:
Updating my review because its been a while....



Pros:

- Possibilities for building are nearly limitless and you can build pretty much anything and everything
- Most of the community is nice.
- Community made patcher with a translator which comes in extremely useful since a large percentage of the community speaks Japanese.

Cons:

- Developer is gone (Since Autumn 2017) but only ever listened to the JP community.
- Most of the time it is inactive (0-5 people). Only really active during daytime in Japan or on holidays.
- "Most" of the community is nice.
- Combat is a shadow of its former self due to the last few updates.
- Poorly optimized with a few annoying bugs.
- Extremely high learning curve with very bad tutorials. You're better off reverse engineering Workshop machines. I have over 2000 hours and i'm still learning things to this day.
- Cloud servers are dying along with the only server region people host on being the JP server means NA and EU players will have a rather high ping (I sit around 190-220ms). There is a successor to MCN being made by a few members within the community so keep an eye out for that.

I know I listed a lot of cons but I still think MachineCraft is a great game and worth at least trying out. In 2016-2017, I would rate this game a 10/10 but after the dev has been gone for a few years and the community is slowly fading away I rate Machinecraft a 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297087563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 37703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2664, 'last_played': 1696341051}
review:
「戦車を走らせたい！」とか「オリジナルのロボを作りたい！」って人にはすっごくおすすめです。
しかし慣れるまで結構わからないことだらけでキツイ…のも事実です、実際私がそうでした。
「難しいからやめる、おすすめしない」って人も結構多いみたいです。本気で作ろうとするとかなり難しいことになってくるのも事実です。その代わりできることは多いです。はっきり言って最初のうちにやめちゃうのはもったいないですぞ

いきなり１から作るのもなかなか難しいので、最初のうちはサンプルのマシンや、配布されているマシンを参考に、自分なりにアレンジしていったりしましょう。そのうちコツが掴めるハズ

悪いところがあるとすればPvPのサーバーがあんまり無いことでしょうか。最初からPvPをしたい人には向いていないかもしれません。作者さんが「マシンの見せ合い」をコンセプトに作っているのでこればっかりは仕方ないのかもしれません…

author: {'steamid': '76561198123535714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1460506873}
review:
During my life, I have been involved with many high level and complicated projects, such as:
Rocket Science
Nuclear Fusion
Brain Surgery
World Finances
Alaskan Crab Fish
UN Negotiations
Quantum Mechanics
... just to name a few.

and with all of that, this game is STILL too complicated. Uninstalled, bu-bye.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055389281', 'num_games_owned': 1043, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1481409045}
review:
I see this game on the free to play, i need to waste time and quickly press the download button i press start and proceed to build crap this is the log of what i built

Day 1 0.4 hours

Built a brick on wheels, i then slapped a gun on the back, cant stop it spinning

Day 1 0.6 hours

I stopped the spinning but now the gun has turned into a helicopter blade, spinning round and round and round

Day 1 1.2 hours

i decided to put swords on the spinning gun and call it a day

Day 1 in bed

I cant stop thinking about machinecraft ideas, hands with lasers coming out the front with a grab feature, a door that opens and unleashes a barrage of destruction on the unsespecting machines. even simple ideas like a helicopter but with swords instead of blades

Day 1 10.2

Just finished making a tank with a giant laser guns, a giant cannon with the stopping power of 15 elephants and the power for it to turn into a sky tank. Oh and also made a duck that when it opens it mouth shoots lasers


so yea, when you start this game it will look complex but it quite simple and soon you will find yourself coming up with brand new ideas to test out. Oh but the best thing? Its a free game not riddles with micros or P2W garbage

Written with Flynn Logic By Flynn

author: {'steamid': '76561198157393642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1460413282}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024377068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1489667220}
review:
I have barely scratched the surface of this game.

I don't even know how to make a turret or wheels that work but I am loving it!!!

I definately plan on following this through development and playing it regularly!

Pros
~Almost unlimited ways to make weapons
~Great community
~This is NOT in fact a ripoff of robocraft
~Better AI then robocraft

Cons
~Needs energy rebalancing, because when you run out your bot ceases to function*
~Unfinished Tutorial*
~Crummy sounds*
~VERY complex and hard to understand "key bind to activate this thing" system

*I understand that these will very likely be improved on in the future as development goes along

Overall a 7/10 for now, will probably update it when G2CREW improves on the game
LOVE IT GUYS

author: {'steamid': '76561198099957565', 'num_games_owned': 562, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2669, 'last_played': 1538518679}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041779541', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 4983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4861, 'last_played': 1467149552}
review:
If you like engineering, mechanics, or simply creating 3d models, this is a game for you.
There is barely any tutoriel yet so itll require a few hours to master it up.

The game lack of any goal really. once you build awesome stuff, you can go pvp, race, or just hang out and show off your builds but there is really nothing to do except creating stuff.

at first it seems a bit pointless but if you manage to master it, youll get sucked in it for days.

I strongly recommend it to anyone with a few hours to waste. But BEWARE! you might wonder where all thoses hours are gone when your clock-alarm rings and its time to go work. Where went the night, i gotta go work and i didnt slept. no wonder my coffee was cold for a while XD

review:

But,they're right. you need to learn some basic stuff before you can make things. 
but it is an [u][i][b]Awesome[/b][/i][/u] game if you understand how to make things. 

Pros:
-GUNS
-Rotator
-HInge
-Piston
-Manual Setup 
-Nice little community

Cons:
-only 1-2 individual servers available
-Hard to learn
-giant orbital laser cannon
-weird looking GUI
-a deadly little things that will come after you and will kill you instantly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064387170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 26883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13391, 'last_played': 1546015022}
review:
DO YOU LIKE SIMPLE, EASY TO LEARN GAMES? WELL
this game probably isn't for you unless you're into learning alot of sh*t in the game.

Machinecraft looks nice and IS nice but in the first hour of playing you will go "WHY WON'T THIS WORK?!?!?" then you play for another few hourse then go "HOW DO I MAKE THIS WORK!?!!?" then you hit the 10-hour mark. After 10 hrs of playing you can now make simple machines like a car, after 50 hrs you make your first plane, after a few 100 failed attempts on how to make and fly one ofcourse. Then the 100-hr mark and you can now make comples stuff but theyre not so polished, then the 200-hr mark (which I have currently), you make your first *insert a unique type of machine here*, after that you now realise that you could've done something with your life with the 200 hours you spent in the game. The game is proud of you, you, your friends, your family not so much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157609610', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 258236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198140, 'last_played': 1678892953}
review:
かつては色々なマシンが動き回り、初心者の方も時間を掛けつつも慣れていっていました。
しかし、現在作者の度重なる修正による仕様の異常な複雑化と余りに発達しすぎたクラフト技術により初心者はまともに周りに見せられる機体すら作れず脱落していくのが大半でしょう。
私もこのゲームにはクラフトゲームの理想として期待していただけに。唯々残念です。
それでもプレイしたいと考えている場合、戦闘については期待しないで下さい。ロボクラフトの代わりを期待して、失望し去っていった方は数えきれません。
追記：ここ数か月アップデートがなされておらず作者の失踪も噂されています。
　　　今からプレイしたいという方はせめて生存が確認されるまでは待機するのが吉かもしれません。
追々記：作者の復活は絶望的となりましたが有志の方がMOD作成に取り組んでいるようで　す。成果次第では事実上の復活もあり得るかも？

author: {'steamid': '76561198151356465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4735, 'last_played': 1500471362}
review:
Brief overview:
This game (if you couldn't tell from the video) is about building machines out of blocks and mechanical parts, then fighting/racing/showing them off to other people. 

There is an astounding amount of creativity in this game. Before anyone asks....No... This is not a rip off of robocraft. robocraft has way too little creativity and too much competitive play to be anywhere near similar to this game, with the exception of using blocks. The biggest thing I like about this game when compared to robocraft is the ability to bind keys.....BIND KEYS!!! You can set little mechanical parts to a key and then assign the same mechanical part on another part of your creation another key. This opens up a world of opportunity, and while the game is difficult to get started with, it is easily worth it. It does take time to get used to building, but when you build that one awesome creation, the amount of satisfaction it brings is unlike any other game. Then, you can battle or show it off to people. It is incredible how addicting this game is.

Pros:
Not too highly competative for people who just want to create things and test them out for fun.
Good community thus far
MASSIVE ammount of creativity.
assigning keys, setting angles for hinges and rotating parts along with setting lengths for pistons
most computers now can handle it without issue
Does not reqiure money for anything but a smoke trail;  has nothing to do with the mechanical aspects of a creation
just.....way too much fun and brings out the creativity in anyone willing to pick up the learning curve.

Cons:
Somewhat difficult to get the hang of building things
Not very populous servers. 

In short, I recomend this game to anyone. It sparks the creativity in everyone's mind and all it takes is a small learning curve. I promise, if you have a creative or imaginitive mind, this game is worth your time and effort.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095917598', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 1815, 'playtime_forever': 3941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1642532225}
review:
I've been playing this game since before it was on Steam and only recently picked it up off Steam, and I'm glad to say that its just as fun as it was pre-Steam! The game is rather fun and easy to pick up thanks to ingame examples! 

Pros
Very easy to pick up
Intuitive building mechanics allow for rather complicated craft
Somewhat easy to run (computer wise)

Cons 
Art style leaves a bit to be desired, but its not horrible by any means
The more advanced techniques aren't the easiest to learn, but examples ingame help alot
Small community at the moment

Conclusion
For what we have to work with so far, I believe that this game holds alot of promise and could evolve to be very popular. 

Kind of similar to Robocraft except you have more design choices. Hell, you can even make a mech or even ANYTHING with this. Absolutely brilliant machine creation game - the online modes and servers seem a bit bare, but just the experience of teaching myself how to make a jeep with working suspension and functioning brake and reversing lights, then mounting a huge gun on a turret on the back, I'm a total fan already. this game is very interesting once you get to know the basics at the start it might not seem much but you cant ask for that much while its such an early relese

 Not P2W. 11/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155164093', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1490123730}

author: {'steamid': '76561198101213333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 261164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10184, 'last_played': 1698548166}
review:
This game is awesome. You can build anything from a little bot with 3-4 blocks to a highly detailed and functional AF Answerer. The only limit is your imagination.

Yes it takes a bit to get used to the building mechanics but, there are samples examples which show the thing that can be done. 

Like in Space Engineers, Starmade, etc. the way you learn is by trial and error so just remember to stay calmned and take your time as you experiment with ways to make your build better. It is basically the best way to learn and enjoy the game rather then just booting up the game and the next just quit because you don't understand how to make your build to work the way you wanted it to. [spoiler] I'm looking at you people with 0.1 hrs played that just say "bad" without taking your time and actually playing around with the mechanics of the game a bit more  (o_o ) [/spoiler] . If you have trouble with your build or you don't understand how something works then don't be afraid to ask people from the community. They can give you tips on how to solve it. 

This game has potential so why not try it out for yourself instead of continuing to read this review.

[spoiler] P.S. You can make AI controlled units as well and-...... I thought I said go and try it yourself already! [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198048338195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 76358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20128, 'last_played': 1619933906}
review:
The greatest sleeper hit I've seen in a long time.

Seen nothing on this game, somehow, but it's been around for a bit now. I enjoyed Starmade, Robocraft, and at some point, the basic Minecraft experience. Yuck.

Long story short: MachineCraft lets you build vehicles. Land. Air. Sea. Space. All done very sandbox style (vs Robocraft's questionable tech tree and grindy research to just get a reskin of a part) with MUCH more dynamic mechanics than some other titles (robocraft and starmade, in my case).

Wanna have folding guns? Great, get some hinges and cannons. Want a blowback action tank cannon? Slip in a piston and some locking blocks, hook it to a fire button and let that baby RIDE! Wanna make a plane? You might have to experiment, but I made a flying van that's a car, sub, and plane all at once. Two days into playing the game.

Amazing entertainment. Incredible vehicle and mechanic building action. Honestly, I can't think of major improvements off the top of my head. You can even do private servers for messing around, and there's very little stress in the game... Just, well, fun!

Edit: After playing a couple hundred hours of this game and becoming a god, all I can say is MachineCraft is the future.

Machinecraft is to mechanical building what minecraft was to open worlds. The possibilities are limited only by what your experience, clever engineering, and of course imagination can dream up. I've found countless ways to improve, streamline, and overclock tech, and I still keep finding more.

Put simply, this game's content isn't about progression or stories or competition. It's about what you can dream, how you can do it, and how you can challenge yourself to make it better. The depth and progression you experience as an engineer is a skill you will pat yourself on the back for and an outlet you will expres yourself in.

Logical or artistic, both find root in this game, and it is as much an outlet as it is a social and competitive experience. I would say this game is beyond words, but I just lugged a couple thousand at you probably, so I digress.

Cons: Addicting to all hell. I'm taking out my warning. You can moderate this game, but the first couple days will be hard.

The premium for this game isn't about edge or about fun stuff, you get a freaking smoke emitter and preference if servers overflow. But you know what? I bought the premium anyways. The guys that make this are damned champions, plain and simple. They've worked for my dollar and then some.

10/10 would buy just because again. And I'm a frugal man.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123214776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 40643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21586, 'last_played': 1567703405}
review:
新一代时间杀手（请看游戏时间= =），目前的开发水平来讲是纯粹的造型游戏。基本游戏内容就是看老外做的机器人然后聊天压马路这样，但是只是这样就很有意思！

一定要把范例都打开看一遍,否则完全不知道什么方块是干什么的。范例都看完就可以做一些简单的机器人了。完成5个挑战后会解锁专家模式。

更新——————

最近上游戏经常有一些带有主题的房间了，

比如无限制TEAMBATTLE房 
使用特定骨架的机体限定的BATTLE房，
螺旋桨飞机限定的空战，
战车限定等等，

总体上来讲比以前可玩性高了很多。
但是缺少官方主题房间支持，而且延迟比较高，离脱离造型游戏还有距离。

author: {'steamid': '76561198125325243', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1485545890}
review:
Robocr-cough Machinecraft is a good alternative to Robocraft. I also play it to learn linking techniques and many else.

Pros:
- Building easy to play, hard to master
- Unique part falling system - instead of cubes the cube groups fall out when took enough damage
- Once you master building you can do crazy things!
- Trolling with claws...nyeh heh heh...

Cons:
- Some of tutorials are still in Japanese (you can understand them though)
- I almost fried my brain up when building my machine.

Conclusion is, read tutorial first before you build. Overally very good.

review: The best F2P game i've played. It's confusing at first for new players but with a bit of trial and error and reverse engineering you can pretty much create a variety of things with little to no problems. I'd even say it's on par with Garry's Mod's complexity of building things.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984336021', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1459609068}
review:
*NOTA: Es acceso anticipado asi que no espereis mucho del juego.

Aun no lo he probado a fondo porque es dificil de construir y demas pero es una pasada, lastima que este en acceso anticipado y aun tenga poca cosa pero de aqui a que sea final sera una rayada de juego aunque espero que no lo abandone.

El juego consiste en que creas tu vehiculo (Coche, Nave, Robot, Moto, lo que te salga, al ser un juego japones la mayoria son chicas Anime lo que hacen) tu decides que teclas asignar y como moverlo, lo que esta genial porque asi no es como Gmod que debes usar el teclado numerico para que funcione tu creacion y ser complicado de manejar en ciertas situaciones.

Los mapas son ilimitados (no estoy seguro pero son bastante grandes) y puedes crear tu fortaleza o chorradas que quieras y que todos los demas jugadores lo usen. Hay uno que esta creando el muro Maria (Ataque a los titanes) y le esta quedando clavado.

Las partidas son online pero puedes crear tus salas privadas para solo amigos y batallar entre todos o hacer carreras o tonterias.

La unica pega es que si quieres cambiar de vehiculo o nave o lo que sea que tengas debes salir de la partida y si eres el creador pues cerrar el server local. Supongo que en un futuro permitira cambiar o quizas ya se puede dentro del nivel (no lo he probado a fondo) 

Por ultimo aunque pida unos requisitos minimos funciona de maravilla en HW ya desfasado. Logicamente si haces construcciones pequeñas porque como entres en una partida con mucha gente y construcciones enormes tu PC empezara a llorar por falta de HW y tendras cuello de botella y caidas de frames considerables y mas si empiezan a disparar a lo loco que eso si que tira los frames un monton.

Resumiendo...

PROS:
- Creacion de "lo que quieras como vehiculo" como para crear un EVA tamaño real.
- Mapa extenso.
- Construcciones dentro del mapa.
- Single player, Lan y Online (salas publicas / privadas).
- Modo prueba contra IA para probar tus creaciones.
- Incluye tutoriales para principiantes y expertos.


CONTRAS:
- La cantidad de objetos para construir lo que quieras tiene poca variedad (casi todo son armas).
- Los controles se hacen un poco tediosos al principio.
- La IA modo prueba batalla te hace la vida imposible para hacer pruebas.
- Los tutoriales estan en Youtube (te saca del juego) y en Japones.
- Solo muestra servidores que tengan un ping inferior a cierta cantidad lo cual si un amigo crea un server y tiene mucho ping por usar 3G o una conexion mala de pueblo pues no podras encontrarlo.


Hay mas cosas pero de momento no he probado tanto como para indicar dichas cosas. Aunque te pide mirar tutoriales con mirar el tutorial Nº1 y 2 es mas que suficiente para comprender el funcionamiento del editor de vehiculos y constructor de mapa.

*NOTA: Vuelvo a recordar que es acceso anticipado y que no espereis mucho del juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117966778', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1497393902}
review:
This is essentially a much more creative, intuitive, and unique robocraft.

Robocraft focuses on the building and fighting element, and takes care of locomotion and technical details for you.

This game, however, is much more heavily weighted towards the creative aspect that you might see in Robocraft. With Robocraft, you just slap on some "walker legs" and you created a mech. In this game you have to configure joints, timing, angles, speed, and logisitics in order to even get a pair of legs to work. 

The gameplay is light (pretty much just dicking around in servers with other people and their creations) but the creative aspect is vast. There are so many different contraptions you could create, and that's why in my opinion this game deserves a positive review.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990509933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1921, 'last_played': 1539380604}
review:
When I saw the title I thought "Oh look, yet another crappy blocktype-clone". Downloaded it never the less since its free and small file size.

I have to say, the amount of freedom blew me away. Very few premade parts, you have to build things yourself. Every functional part as in rotators, hinges, pistons can be custom keybinded with up to 8 or 10 (?) commands simultaniously. Tanks with mouse-controlled turrets, battlemechs, planes, helicopters, its all possible possible to build.

If only more voxel survival games would allow you to build machines like in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080308492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 20280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10738, 'last_played': 1699437604}
review:
簡単に言うといろいろな種類のブロックを使って自分だけのロボットを作ろうッて感じ。まあ、なんでも作れるんだけど
ちなみにブロックごとの役割を覚えればいろいろ作れるけどまずチュートリアル動画見よう！
あと、デフォルトでも機体が何個かあるからそれをバラしながら作るのもよし（ちゃんとコピーはしておこうね）
ちなみにオンラインがあるけど部屋によっては戦闘しないでロボットの見せ合いの部屋とかあるからちゃんと周りの雰囲気で察しようね
あと他人が不快に思う機体はやめようね





[spoiler]　ただひとつ言わせてもらえばやってる人の態度とか民度によってはどんなに良いゲームでもクソになるからね　[/spoiler]

review: This game is awesome. You build machines to destory other player's machines. It has a very simalar consept to robocraft, but there are no microtransactions, and it is less ballnced. On the downside, it does not have very many blocks, but i think that it is fine, they should add workshop support(I think that workshop is being worked on), and there should be voxel desturction of the vehicle(the vehicle should fly to peices), not just the health system they have now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129124128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1685, 'last_played': 1481426351}
review:
I've been playing this game since before it was on Steam and only recently picked it up off Steam, and I'm glad to say that its just as fun as it was pre-Steam! The game is rather fun and easy to pick up thanks to ingame examples! 

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*] Very easy to pick up
[*] Intuitive building mechanics allow for rather complicated craft
[*] Somewhat easy to run (computer wise)
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b] [spoiler]Note that most of these can be excused since its early release[/spoiler]
[list]
[*] Art style leaves a bit to be desired, but its not horrible by any means
[*] The more advanced techniques aren't the easiest to learn, but examples ingame help alot
[*] Small community at the moment
[/list]

[b]Conclusion[/b]
For what we have to work with so far, I believe that this game holds alot of promise and could evolve to be very popular.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124921581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1508297803}
review:
Alle Leute, die dieses Spiel ankucken und anschließend sagen, dass das die nachmache von Robocraft sei, sollten sich das Spiel erstmal genauer unter die Lupe nehmen bevor die sowas sagen, denn hier geht es um das Bauen von Mechanischereren Dingen als in Robocraft und man KANN  kämpfen man MUSS NICHT gegeneinander kämpfen. Es zweigt sich von Robocraft also ab und ist zudem auch ne mischung aus Robocraft und Scrap Mechanic und so ein fünkchen Garry`s mod, weil du selber die umgebung so ein bisschen umbauen kannst.  (habe ich selber noch nicht gemacht)

Positive Eigenschaften:

-Man kann hier ganz komplizierte Dinge bauen und das sogar noch relativ riesig (mega Groß)

-Man kann mit mehreren Leuten zusammen spielen und sich gegenseitig über sein gebautes Etwas angeben

-Es ist noch Early Access und deshalb kann (und ich hoffe mal stark dass das so sein wird)  es sich noch sehr stark verändern/ verbessern

Negative Eigenschaften/ Dinge die Sie besser machen könnten:

-Man sollte die Mechanischen Bauteile (Piston, usw. )  besser beschreiben,  weil ich mal ein Fahrzeug gebaut habe, und dann die mechanik so falsch lief, dass ich ein video suchen musste :D

-Ich wollte mein eigenes Fahrzeug bekämpfen ......  Ihr könnt euch schon denken was da nicht lief (Alles)

-es sollte aber wie in Robocraft möglich sein sofort diesen einen Block exakt so und nicht anders hinzusetzen (nicht danach erst die kanten wegmachen müssen)    Das hat mich sehr stark irritiert und somit musste ich es dann nochmal neubauen, was daraufhin zum  ICH-HABE-KEINEN-BOCK-MEHR-EINEN-NEUEN-ZU-BAUEN-WEIL-ICH-MICH-SONST-WIEDER-AUFREGEN-KÖNNTE Satz führen würde.     

 Aber im Gesamten Finde ich das Spiel sehr sehr Gut   :)         man muss sich halt mal an die mechanik gewöhnen dann läuft alles wie geschmiert   zwischen S und A oder was das bedeuten sollte :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198163319693', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1459483357}
review:
I played this a little before it was on steam, and it takes a long time to learn how everything works. Nothing is really buggy and its a good sandbox to make something creatively, and its like an alpha version of RoboCraft, but more complicated. The default controls are confusing, so you probably should rebind them, and there are a lot of different keys for different things which is confusing. But overall, i think the game is good, but it will take someone a little while to understand everything.

Good: 
• Lots of possibilites for things to make
• Weapons to put on what you make
• More weapons
• Multiplayer
• Lots of freedom
• Controls are similar to RoboCraft 
• Video tutorials
Bad:
• Very early access...(?)
• Hard to understand everything at first
• Very quiet background (no music or ambience)
• Some translations are bad
• No in game building tutorial, only video tutorials.

I think its good, playable how it is now and there is a lot of possibilities of what you could make. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198020845329', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 18896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12836, 'last_played': 1628128071}
review:
MachineCraft is a vehicle/contraption builder with a large amount of creative freedom and fantastic building tools, but poor tutorials, and ultimately not much to do with the bots you make. Despite it's flaws MachineCraft remains one of the best creative oriented builders even before it's low price of free.


[h1]The Good:[/h1]
+Nearly Free: no IAP except cosmetic DLC
+QoL building features like sliding connected block-chunks, wireless block pairers
+Scripting support for crafts (C# with (discontinued?) lua support)
+Map editor


[h1]The Bad:[/h1]
-Ugly & occasionally unintuitive UIs
-Out-of-the-way and subpar "tutorial" (you have to load sample machines and press Tab to see what may or may not be an adequate explanation for that subject)
-Minor grievances; arbitrarily finite keybinds per build, mirror not mirroring hinges and rotators correctly

author: {'steamid': '76561198134656087', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1466802164}
review:
Pros.
- A lot, and I mean a LOT, of customization.
- Simple stage building.
- Several different gamemodes.
- Quite a lot of technical variables for building.
- Rather nice community.
- The samples can quickly teach you how to use every part in the game, and how to build things like mechs and walkers.

Cons.
- Finding servers is a gamble. Most of the time, I'll only ever find two servers open.
- The combat isn't very-well developed. It seems all combat-based servers are entirely free-for-all.
- Not a lot to do in singleplayer.
- The optimization needs a bit of work. Dropped to 10 fps on a server with ~20 players, most using reasonably medium-sized machines.
- You can expect your stuff to break from each update. Played before it was on Steam, transferred a rather-complex artillery tank to the Steam version, only to find that weight and piston strengths were changed, effectively breaking the main gun on the tank.
- The descriptions of certain functions and parts can be [i]very[/i] vague at times, but this is most likely from machine translations.

I really like this game, but I do not find it to be a replacement to Robocraft, not in the slightest.
Overall, 7.5/10, because it can still use some more polishing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193535646', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1473120482}
review: MachineCraft, to me, seems to be what RoboCraft tried, and failed, to be. A game where your sole purpose, is just to make contraptions with some kind of propulsion (though not necessary) and weapons of some sort (again, not exactly necessary). I would hold off on giving it too harsh a review, simply because it is early access, and it's very clear that some of the english translations could use some work. All in all, good game, but we should let it grow a bit more before we really start to scrutinize it.

review:
Extremely fun, there is some getting used to everything in this game, but it is amazing once you figure it out. You can make massive flying squids that shoot lazers out of its tenticles, you can make a sled that goes ~900 kilometers per hour, and there is a lot of fun involved in experimenting, and then showing off what you managed to make. The players, what few there are, are mostly nice if you try to talk to them.


Update September 16, 2018: Using steamplay, latest graphic drivers(For AMD Radeon 480RX), and Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, I can run this game on Ubuntu, too! Though, there is a BUG - The gui doesn't show up properly; text on buttons does NOT load, but it works okay otherwise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105679248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1459170063}
review:
Shorter Version:

This game attempts to compete with Robocraft's design and fails miserably at it. The GUI is hard to understand, even with the F1 help menu, building isn't as easy as it should be and controls are even worse. To top it all off, some weapons are just overpowered and some are very underpowered.

Your machine can only fire in the direction that your bot is facing if you're using a blaster, making it difficult to get those excellent shots. Lock-on rockets always tend to hit the ground, even if the opponent is grounded the entire duration of the projectile flight.

Longer Version:

1. GUI. The graphics interface looks like it came from an old Flash game. When the game starts you have a bunch of buttons on all sides of the screen, all with words. In the center is a 'MachineCraft' logo and your currently selected machine. When you click on the 'Link' buttons in the bottom, it brings up a bunch of tutorials. We all love tutorials right? Well turns out that 'Link' actually meant URL Link. That's right my friend, it opens up YouTube videos! It's sort of a let down that you have to watch a video in order to learn to play. Players that prefer in-game tutorials will not be pleased.

2. Building. Clicking on 'Build' takes you to the building garage. If you didn't do the tutorial your first look would will have you going 'huh?' Once you start to build your own machine, you might get confused with the interface. I know I did at first but I soon got used to it. One thing that is great about the game is that you can customize just about anything. A not so great thing is you have to customize simple things such as if a wheel should roll or if a hinge should be allowed to bend. My first and only build was a Launcher Tower. I skipped the moving mechanics and decided I only wanted to build a building but I added the launchers so I'd have some kind of weapon. Plus they were pretty. Another thing I don't like is that when I went to test the tower with rotators attached, guess what? I forgot to tell the rotators they need to... you guessed it... rotate!

3. Mobility. Maybe adding an anti-gravity device to the tower wasn't such a bright idea. But I became determined to make it hover. Turns out a **** looking structure won't stay upright. I was saddened when the tower tilted and became limp. After a while I gave up and decided to use thrusters. Thrusters, my friends, are a pain in the ***. Not only do I need to tell the bottom thrusters to go up, I need to put thrusters that will know to go down and every other direction. With a thin tower and not much room to place other thrusters, I scrapped that idea and gave up with adding something to move the tower around. If you like to tell your movement devices what they should actually be doing, this game is for you.

4. Combat. So I get into this match with a bot and I'm all like, I'mma kill you! I load up those plasma rockets and before I could fire. My tower blew up. I looked at the bots life, looked at mine. Look at the bots machine, looked at mine... thin was not the way to go. So I decided to use the pre-made bot to try combat. Match started and I'm so used to looking at my target with a crosshair that I didn't even notice there was no crosshair. I fired but the cannons shot forward. I turned the machine and fired again. Okay so the starting bot doesn't have **** for aiming. I found the button for plasma and decided to use that. Plasma fires at full energy, heads to the bot, the bot glides on the ground, the plasma hits the floor. I shot another, plasma hits the floor. So I'm like, great. My weapons took a piss on me. If you're one of those players like me and you prefer your weapons not to be stupidly dumb, this game is not for you.

5. Multiplayer. I went online to play. Turns out there's not many people who do play online and the ones who do sit afk. Maybe it was the time I was online or maybe not many people actually play this game. One thing is for sure, if you're expecting to go head-to-head with someone. Expect a lot of 'show your machine off' rooms.

Overall I would not recommend this game to anyone. It has a few great things but not enough to weigh out the bad things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129014352', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1487635558}
review:
The current idea of this game is what Robocraft should've been. Building complex, but easy things and showing them off to other people. No paying and microtransactions and that other crap.

Pros:
-Game comes with tutorials and complex tools to make whatever you desire.
-You get everything free.
-Some other people are online (and I hope you become one of them!)
-So far, a pretty amazing community (Only a small ammount of trolls imo)
-Learn from what others have built and try and do better
-Get your friends and show off eachothers creativity
-Make a variety of things, from Walkers and Mechs, to Tanks, Cars, Jets, all sorts of stuff!


Cons:
-In order to get every tool you need to start building complex machines, you first need to complete tedious challenges.
-Graphics I guess? I honestly care about gameplay more but whatever.
-The official tutorial playlist for this game has Japanese captions that need to be translated. It is honestly not very interactive. There is also a lack of proper tutorials because it has such a small community.
-Although a good community so far, I'm afraid the time will come before people start building inappropriate things, then the creator will have to focus on moderation.
-The game gives you complex tools, but so far you might not be able to do whatever you imagine. Just give it time.

Give this game a try considering it's free. I honestly hope this game doesn't go into the direction of Robocraft.

EDIT: Tfw people are able to make all these amazing, detailed tanks, mechs, anime girls (lolwut), freakish laser-eye shooting Neptunes, mini soldiers, I can't do anything cool without taking something from the workshop and looking like an idiot that can't build. ;-;

author: {'steamid': '76561198091046194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1563585133}

author: {'steamid': '76561198279903970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1460152081}
review:
First of all, people should stop comparing this game to robocraft. Robocraft is a game aimed at balanced fighting wheras this is a game instead about creativity and design. Also Robocraft has been around for a long time and this game has only been out for a day so of course Robocraft is better at this time.

That aside, lets look at the pros and cons:

PROS:
 - Because nothing in this works automatically, you have lots freedom of design.
 - They have made it so that you can fully customise what keys control what part of your vehicle.
 - The community (although small) is very nice.
CONS:
 - It is not very intuitive and it takes time to work out how to do things.
 - The UI is not the best.
 - Workshop intergration would be nice.

In summary, this is a (very) early access game with a great potential and I would suggest that you should give it a try.

Edit: Tweaked a few things to make what I am trying to say clearer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145539442', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1459817410}
review:
MachineCraft is a machine vehicle sandbox in which you can build robots, cars, even starships. Whatever your heart desires, you can probably create it.  It has great graphical quality and excellent all around functionality.


Now to mention the biggest flaw with this game that you'll immediately notice when you install (going on the fact your Steam language is probably on English if you're reading this).  There aren't any executables! All you need to do is set the language of the game to 日本語 and it will work perfectly, even displaying in English. Beyond that, I have yet to find any bugs. You should certainly read other reviews and maybe try this game for yourself.


[I] If the devs read this, include an in-game tutorial in a future update, please. [/I]

author: {'steamid': '76561198106636924', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1459079155}
review:
Хрень редкостная, настройки движения сделаны через одно место. Колёса вечно крутятся в рfзные стороны, то же касается и остальных механизмов. Про ноги уж вообще молчу.
Наиболее бездарно потраченный час за всю мою жизнь.

Это было первое впечатление.

Время от времени смотрел на иконку в стиме, думая удалить или оставить. В итоге любопытство взяло верх и я продолжил мучить этого ребёнка робокрафта, лего и скриптов.
В итоге научился поворачивать колёса туда, куда нужно, разобрался с настройкой блоков, сделал зенитку, прилепил к ней крылья и отправился в полёт.

И вообще, смотрю на поделки остальных игроков и диву даюсь. То у них Икс-Винги, то Соколы тысячелетия, то целые трансформеры с двигающимися руками и мечами. 

Одним словом, огромный простор для фантазии. Только если у вас эта самая фантазия есть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145612657', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 989143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 131, 'playtime_at_review': 118517, 'last_played': 1712394498}
review:
みなさんはそのマシクラの造形の自由度についておっしゃられておりますが、僕としてはそれに加えて推したいことは「場所を選ばず」「最大まで制限なしにあらゆるパーツを費用無しで使え」「無限にマシンを作れる」というところです

まず第一に場所を選ばず、ということですが、マシンのビルドは完全オフラインで行われるために、ネットワーク接続を必要としません。
ということはつまり、出先等でインターネットの有無にかかわらずマシンのビルドができる、ということになります。
加えて必要スペックもハードルの低いものとなっており、最近のノートパソコンならほぼ支障なく動作させることができるでしょう。

次にパーツが制限なしに使用できるということですが、もちろんサーバーに入室するために7000ブロックほどのが上限であるとはいえ、中程度のサイズのマシンであればまず5000を超えることは稀であり、また「ソードやキャノン、シャシーブロックを購入する」という煩わしい仕様も全くないので、ほぼ際限なく使用できるといっても過言ではありません。

最後に無限にマシンを作れるということですが、そもそもガレージ数という概念がなく、フォルダにマシンのデータ（.mcad、.mcbdの二種類）がぶち込んであるだけなのでいくらでも増やすことができます。
また、マシンのコピー機能を使い、挑戦的な造形をしてミスをしても、コピー元のをロードすれば元通り、という利点もありますし、マシンインポート機能でもでもガレージ制限がないというのは役立ってきます。

造形面でもとても優秀なマシクラですが、他の面でもまた優秀な部分が沢山あり、そしてそれはほぼ全てフリー、つまり無料でできるということで、まさしく「神ゲー」という名がふさわしいのではないでしょうか。
そしてこれでもまだ開発段階ということで、まだまだこの先の成長にとても胸が高鳴る所存であります。

[追記]Ver.0.216より描画品質が改良され、他のクラフトゲーに対してもなんら遜色のないグラフィックとなりました
[url=i.imgur.com/Ld0c4xL.png] 参考画像１ [/url]
[url=i.imgur.com/kbwhBWk.png] 参考画像２ [/url]

私的なことですが、作者さん、ver.003からここまで（勝手ながら）ついてこさせていただき有難う御座いました。
Steamでの先行公開の達成、ひと段落ついたということで、おめでとうございます。これからも是非頑張ってください。

author: {'steamid': '76561197997175557', 'num_games_owned': 735, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 2600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 919, 'last_played': 1479654137}
review:
2014年の半ばくらいから開発が始まった、ロボクラフトやパネキットの影響を受けた機体クラフトゲーム
無料で遊べるからとりあえず触ってみよう

このゲームの機体作成の自由度はかなり高いから、色んな物をつくれるぞ
特にその機体のキーバインドや動作を細かく設定できるのはすばらしい
これのおかげで、複雑な動きをする機体もそこまで苦労せずに作れるんだ
ある程度慣れれば、アニメみたいに変形するロボットもつくれるぞ

一方俺は、一見ふつうの顔が真ん中から半分に割れて、クソ醜い真の顔を見せつけてくるロボットや、
口から弾幕を放ちながら血走った目玉を伸ばしたり縮ませたりしながら突っ込んでいく、Kerbal星人の生首ロボットをつくっていたのであった・・・

author: {'steamid': '76561198088677212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 18159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14413, 'last_played': 1497424461}
review:
Machinecraft - Японская игра, созданная, по мнению некоторых, по образу более известного Robocraft (откуда я в своё время и свалил в машин, да и, судя по отзывам на рыбу, скоро многие последуют моему и не только примеру).
+: "Ангар" (если это так можно назвать) 99х99х99 (В робо мега-ангар вроде меньше).
>+: Однако никто не запрещает находиться блокам за пределами ангара. Просто используйте поршни.
+: Полная (в пределах трёх измерений) свобода в скульптинге блоков.
+: Суставы и поршни, без которых практически не возможно построить нормальные кравты, легки в освоении (единственные моменты, где вы будете хвататся за голову, это когда будете путать градусы в Angle суставах).
+: Группы Объектов: Возможность разделить поставленные блоки на 6 (с учётом соединительной Merge - 7) групп.
+: Сниженный процент неадекватов на серверах. UPD: Fixed by Guest.
+: Плюшки эксперт мода:
>+: Расширенный Скульпт Мод (вторая вкладка): Кроме углов мы сможем "урезать" (до 1\8 куба и т.п.) и "вталкивать" (блок "звезда", где находится место куба, и рядом текстура куба) блоки.
>+: Где-то +5 страниц для назначения клавиш (изначально доступно 2) P.S. 1 страница = 10 клавишам.
>+: Прочие плюшки для "Ангара"
+: Мультиплеер до 30 человек на сервер (27 для всех и 3 для премиумов).
+: Можно скриптить (На LUA) кравты.
+: Необязательность доната (на данный момент). Донат вообще ничего практически не решает (разве что степень неадекватности испускаемых дымов и транслируемые штампом изображения). (есть вероятность потери актуальности)
+: Возможность строительства своих карт. (Причём при наличии нужного софта ограниченная лишь рамками Unity; Подробностей не знаю).
>-: Однако для создания более менее годного экземпляра вы ОБЯЗАНЫ иметь ровную голову, прямые руки и кисти (пятипальцевый экземпляр) вместо клешней.
+: Буквально недавно завезли Графон. Не шедевр, но всяко лучше того что было, хотя и не привычно видеть это.
+: Чертежи. Теперь, если вы намерены делать модель (именно модель!) исторического автомобиля\корабля\танка\тянки, вы можете загрузить в игру чертежи на плоскости X, Y и Z.
>-: Однако эти чертежи вам никто не выдаст. Ищите сами, а потом ещё и разбирайтесь в этом, а перед этим ещё обрезать до нужного качества не забудьте.
=: В игре в основном Русские и Японцы. Другие национальности не встречал. UPD: Fixed by Steam
=: Отсутствие Русского перевода игры. (Возможно, оно временное, однако это не является большой проблеммой, тк при скудном знании англиского/японского вполне можно разобратся что да как) (переключение языков с англ. на яп.: L+N+G)
=: При установке игры не скачиваются сами файлы игры. Скорее всего, скоро это будет исправленно. UPD: Уже не актуально
=: На уровне ковра (низкий) онлайн утром. Скорее всего, со временем исправится само по себе.
-: Для строительства среднесортных кравтов нужны: Руки (пятипальцевый экземпляр) (2 штуки), Мозги (работоспособные), Отсутствие рогов, Ручная кладь времени.
-: Для строительства годноты нужны: Руки (пятипальцевый экземпляр) (2 штуки), Мозги (работоспособные), Отсутствие рогов, Багаж времени, Карандаш\Ручка (по желанию), Блокнот\Тетрадь в клетку (по желанию).
-: На сервер пускает только машины, у кого меньше 65 боди. На низко- и средне- качественных кравтах не заметно, но на годноте или просто многободиевках раздражает игроков.
-: Другие минусы (которых может быть очень мало), которые остались мною незамеченными.
(!)Новичков смутят внутриигровые гайды, а вернее, их иноязычность, а порой и полное отсутствие.
(!): Игра не совсем будет понятна новым игрокам. Не советую вам включать эксперт мод, пока не ознакомитесь хотя-бы на уровне банальных [Car] и [Walker] с устройством игры. В глубины эксперт мода не советую лезть, не отсидев в игре хотя-бы пару-тройку обновлений (не a -> b -> c, а 2x1 -> 2x2 -> 2x3). (скажу честно, я сам там малость до конца не разобрался там)
(!): Так же советую вам изучить кравты из папки _sample. Если внезапно обнаружите данную папку с содержимым в более ранних вариантах (к примеру, наличие кравтов Runner или Hummer), их тоже советую к осмотру.
(!) Тянку_как_у_того_японца вам никто не даст. Вернее, воркшоп то даст, но дальше вы должны будете сами делать из неё годноту. И никто не гарантирует, что у вас получится.
(!)Игра не для любителей "Игра делает всё за игрока", как и подобает песочнице. 
(Касательно обновлений): Даже не пытайтесь вычислить частоту их выхода. Просто положитесь на великий рандом в этом плане.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063375940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 25102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4448, 'last_played': 1710187401}
review:
何でも作れます！己の想像力、創造力、そして何より根気！
様々な力を駆使して自分の好きな機体を作れます！
戦車、戦闘機、戦艦の様な現実的な兵器から、二足歩行、四足歩行、六脚の様な多脚兵器
宇宙戦艦、他ロボット、武装神姫等も（サイズは再現できません　残念）
外見は拘れば拘る程どのような物でも作れます
ただ、何でも作れると言っても、サイズ、ブロック数制限、歯車等の複雑な内部構造は作れません。（見た目の再現くらいは出来ますが）
とにかく自分の想像力、創造力、根気（あと妥協）さえあれば何でも作れる!って言うゲームだと覚えてください！

なに？思っているもんが作れないだって？慣れろ　究極的には、作り方は慣れろですからね?

基本的に作り方を覚えるのに一番良いのは、公開してある作品を研究する事です。あと、鯖で他人の物をじっくり拝見する事。
チュートリアルとwikiもどきを見ながら作っていけば、大抵の初心者的な疑問は解決できるはずです。

あと鯖ごとにローカルルールがあります。
ある鯖では攻撃を極力禁止（相手の同意を得たらOK）、ブロック置き禁止、特定の機体（大抵戦車やREXと呼ばれる二足歩行ロボ群）のみ参加可能。等です。
ローカルルールを破れば大抵警告があり、それでも守らなければサーバー主からBANを食らいます。
他のゲームと比べてサーバー説明等に記述されたりして、変な用語も無く、暗黙のルールという訳でもなく、ローカルルールも解りやすくなっているため、記述されているルールさえわかればどんどん入って楽しんでくださいね。

ワークショップに機体を公開する機能が追加された事により、今まで以上に改造OKの所謂素体的な機体が公開されています。
初心者さんはこれを利用して、１からは無理でも、２，３は自分らしい機体を作る！と言う目標も生まれるでしょう。
がんばってくださいね

author: {'steamid': '76561198061132728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2236, 'last_played': 1464191760}
review:
MachineCraft ถ้าจะให้กล่าว มันเหมือน RoboCraft ฉบับญี่ปุ่นมาก
ความเหนือชั้นของเกมนี้คืออุปกรณ์ต่างๆ ที่เราสามารถตกแต่งได้ละเอียดมากขึ้น ยกตัวอย่างแค่ทำให้ล้อวิ่งได้ เราต้องติดตั้งแกนหมุนและติดตั้งล้อ จากนั้นก็เข้าไปเซ็ทแก่นหมุนของล้อแล้วติดตั้งปุ่มกดเพื่อให้แกนหมุนทำงาน ซึ่งมันละเอียดมาก (สามารถศึกษาได้ที่ตรงกลางหน้าจอเกมในหน้าท็อปเกม จะมีคลิปลิงค์ตรงกับ Yotube สอนอยู่)

ชมเกม
- เป็นเกมที่เนื้อที่และสเป็คเบามาก
- ลายละเอียดเกมแยอะมาก สามารถประยุกษ์รูปแบบการสร้างได้หลากหลาย
- โหมดการเล่นตอนนี้ ห้องfreeไว้โชว์หุ่น ห้องทีมแบ็ทเทิล ห้องตีมั่ว และห้องแข่งรถ และเราสามารถสร้างห้องเพื่อเล่นกับเพื่อนๆ ได้อีกด้วย
- คุณสามารถสร้างได้ตั้งแต่ รถถัง เรือ เครื่องบินยันยานอวกาศ ในสภาพพื้นที่ต่างๆ 
-  คนญี่ปุ่นและรัสเซ๊ยในเกมที่เคนเล่นก่อนจะมาลงในสตรีมน่ารักมาก

ติเกม
- ตอนนี้ยังมีบัคเอย แทบเครื่องมือไม่ครบเอย แต่คิดว่าน่าจะแก้เร็วๆ นี้
- จุุดสำคัญบางอย่างของเกมยังเป็นภาษาญี่ปุ่นอยู่ (ปุ่ม F1 ในห้องสร้าง)
-  การสร้างค่อนข้างยากและละเอียดพอสมควร ไม่เหมาะสำหรับคนที่ไม่มีความอดทน

author: {'steamid': '76561198142798423', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 5508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5508, 'last_played': 1651898480}
review: I loved this game, I really did. But I must move on. This game is dead. I would suggest playing it's inspired successor: Tinker Tech. If you are unaware of this new game, it is this game but with a healthy community. Also there are plans for a porting tool to port builds from this game to Tinker Tech.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159654089', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 126452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1692705187}
review:
ほぼCADと言っても遜色のない自由度を誇るクラフトゲームです。
戦闘も可能ですがそれがメイン要素ではないので、自由にクラフトを楽しめます。
マップもユーザー側で作成可能、ガレージの内装もカスタムできたりと限りなく自由度の高いゲームです。
機体にLuaスクリプトを組み込んで自律動作させることも可能です。
